connector.description:
Create a secret in AWS Secrets Manager

The Kamelet expects the following headers to be set:

- `secret-name` / `ce-secret-name`: as the secret name to create.

If the header won't be set the exchange ID will be used as secret name.

camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.a.name: camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.accessKey
camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.a.description: The access key obtained from AWS.

camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.s.name: camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.secretKey
camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.s.description: The secret key obtained from AWS.

camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.r.name: camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.region
camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.r.description: The AWS region to connect to. Example: eu-west-1
